data.text:
@just_esmer Ok. Go ahead and attach yourself to the hate. I'll just attach myself to the assumption that he doesn't walk around like an idiot who just spews out hate at women 24 hours a day. And we can just ride our own wave to the shore on this one.

#SurfsUp #GrrrLol

@just_esmer I'm not saying how Trump really meant it. I'm merely adding in that this assumption he meant "b!tch" is not supported in a linguistic sense.

Also, I don't think you actually believe that someone, Trump or otherwise, must degrade women every time they speak about them.

@david_mivshek Trump is in context every time he opens his mouth. When he speaks of a woman it is to degrade her, in every way. To try and parse this into something only an intellectual could understand is "disingenuous" to say the least... 

it was a play on the term " hemming and hawing"

@just_esmer Honestly, a bit lost in your reply here. I'm distracting/deflecting? If I'm confused I ask questions. I know a lot of people troll or just say things to argue angrily. I'm actually wondering what you're saying. And why "heehaw?"
@david_mivshek Trump never met a woman he didn't degrade. just ask @PressSec

@david_mivshek you asked a question, and the question has been answered. of course you are going to distract and deflect

#HeeHaw

@just_esmer That definition is out of context. The situation had nothing to do with judging beauty. And equating beauty to being a b!tch isn't an accepted standard by any means. Which is why I didn't mention the definition.
